definition: to touch/to make contact with sth/to stir up sb's emotions
lit. shocks the eye, astonishes the heart (idiom); shocking/horrible to see/a ghastly sight

sentences.english: We should draw a moral from the startling fact.
sentences.chinese: 我们应当从这些触目惊心的事实中吸取教训。

sentences.english: The number of youngsters involved in crime is frightening .
sentences.chinese: 卷入犯罪的青少年人数令人触目惊心。

sentences.english: The streets abound with beggars and pickpockets.
sentences.chinese: 这些街上乞丐和扒手触目皆是。

sentences.english: All the relevant food safety reports, shocking ah.
sentences.chinese: 这阵子有关食品安全的报道篇篇触目惊心啊。

sentences.english: At this time, the situation was appalling.
sentences.chinese: 当时清扫工的状况是触目惊心的。

sentences.english: "watchdog" Li Jinhua also opened a horrifying "list".
sentences.chinese: “看门狗”李金华又开出触目惊心的“清单”了。

sentences.english: I do not recall who the taste of the pain so startling .
sentences.chinese: 我不会想起谁，那般疼痛的滋味触目惊心。

sentences.english: However, the third generation of Volvo's news, is always eye-catching feature.
sentences.chinese: 但有关富豪第三代的新闻，始终是惹人触目。

sentences.english: Ain. My eye hath wasted my soul because of all the daughters of my city.
sentences.chinese: 因我城中的一切女儿，使我触目伤心。

sentences.english: Looking ahead, the whole chicken in a mess, shocking.
sentences.chinese: 放眼望去，整个鸡场狼藉一片，触目惊心。

sentences.english: So this city is as eye-catching fashion walking corpses as puppets.
sentences.chinese: 于是这座城市里触目便是行尸走肉般的时尚傀儡。

definition: to appear before one's eyes/pleasing to the eye/nice to look at
fills the eyes (of a beautiful view, scene of desolation etc)
to lie in disarray/to cut across/to traverse
wound/skin ulcer/(fig.) the desolation of trauma/desolation in the aftermath of a disaster
lit. bumps and bruises everywhere (idiom); fig. an ugly shambles/devastation everywhere
to appear before (one's eyes)/to come to (one's mind)
(idiom) to greet the eye/to come into view
